lines.text: Pushing or pulling that can cause acceleration
Objects move at constant velocity unless acted on by a net force

secText:
Enduring Understandings:
1. A [OBJ:expsec_e754:force] causes the acceleration of an object. [OBJ:wb_force_examples:Examples of forces] include friction, gravity, and tension.
2. Forces can be added to calculate the [OBJ:expsec_e756:net force] on an object.
3. [OBJ:expsec_e758:Newton's first law] states that an object will continue to move at a constant velocity unless a net force acts upon it.
